result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua G Helfenstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua G Helfenstein is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua G Helfenstein was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription AMENDED FROM Possession of Narcotic Drugs, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Joshua G Helfenstein was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Successfully complete Drug Court Treatment program.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes:
30 days to be served, balance is stayed.  12-26-2014 AMENDED:  Defendant to be released on 01-02-2015 to Nancy Smith (DOC) ONLY for transport to group home. Balance of days to be stayed.  
**AMENDED 09-02-2013:  Defendant to serve two days in the Racine County Jail for sanctions.  REPORT IN on Friday, September 4 at 5:00 pm and to be released at 5:00 pm on September 6, 2015.  **

Preliminary hearing on October 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
